results.title: Physics: an interactive approach
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gilles Boivin and Jacques Parent
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates how the study of physics improves when students have the opportunity to work out the problems actively. Shown is a classroom-turned-laboratory, where films or film loops permit experiments to be staged on screen under control of the students. By starting or stopping films at will, any particular image or development can be measured on the screen and plotted on the students’ work sheets. Simple equipment for physics experiments is also shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Gilles Boivin and Jacques Parent

results.title: Physics on television
results.creator_credit: Centre for Educational Television Overseas and Gordon Severn
results.brief_description: Some practical problems in producing an educational television program on physics. Shows good and bad displays, difficulties in showing laboratory equipment, use of filmed inserts, split screen and superimposition.

results.title: Physics in the world around us
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and Lily Steiner
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage high school students to continue with physics studies. Looks at five different areas of physiscs, explains the basic principles and their relevance to daily life, future technology and job prospects.

results.title: Physics demonstration: Tyndall's apparatus
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and MGM International Films
results.brief_description: This is a demonstration of the heat capacity of different substances. Balls of various metals, all of the same weight, are heated in boiling water, removed simultaneously and placed on a sheet of wax. The rate at which they melt through the wax is observed and the question is posed as to why the melting rates are different.

results.title: Physics and chemistry of water
results.creator_credit: Unilever Films, World Wide Pictures, Peter Bradford and Sarah Erulkar
results.brief_description: Explains how the molecular structure of water determines its unique properties, discussing the solid, liquid and gaseous phases, surface tension, solvent action and the thermal properties which provide a stable environment for life.

results.title: Physicists for industry
results.creator_credit: Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology, Trafford Price and John Garrity
results.brief_description: Promotes the various course of options in Applied Physics for prospective students. It emphasizes the practical project work involved and the fields of industry open to graduates. Such as the interior design for the acoustics at the Melbourne Concert Hall etc.

results.title: Physical sciences: mountain building
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Carey Crones
results.brief_description: By using animation and models, various events in geological history are re-enacted. The film opens by giving a survey of the evidence scientists have for such interpretations of geological history as are given in this film, and, in the last sequences, mention is made of the importance to engineers and metallurgists of the scientist’s ability to interpret past geological history.

results.title: Physical fitness and good health
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ken Peterson and Les Clark
results.brief_description: Uses animation to hows how exercise helps build muscle tissue and increase the capillaries’ capacity to supply blood to body parts; presents live action sequences of animals to show that rest is essential to all forms of animal life; discusses the importance of a proper diet for physical fitness and good health.

results.title: Physical examination
results.brief_description: A physical examination need not be a mysterious and fearful experience of young children. This film prepares the child by explaining the process, step-by-step, in a gently humorous way. Parents and medical personnel also learn how to describe examination procedures to children so that their fears and anxieties are minimized.

results.title: Physical education: children aged 4 to 6 years
results.brief_description: This documentary runs through the set guidelines established by the Board of Education work schedule for infants’ first school year. Instructed in the development through free activity, independent action self control, lightens, flexibility and alertness. Based on he Board of Eduction syllabus of physical education for school, 1933.
